question.xref: DES s11, HC r258, HC r269
question.text: You are travelling on a motorway. A red cross is shown above the hard shoulder. What does this mean?

explanation.text: When a red cross is shown above the hard shoulder it should only be used for breakdowns or emergencies. Within Active Traffic Management (ATM) areas the hard shoulder may sometimes be used as a running lane. Speed limit signs directly above the hard shoulder will show that it’s open.

answer.text: Use this lane as a rest area
Use this as a normal running lane
Do not use this lane to travel in
National speed limit applies in this lane
